intro: Pilosella boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian goatweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by pale green or white ray florets. Pilosella boliviensis is often found in high-altitude regions and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
